description: The trap should be sent each time the device real-time
clock change its value.
The date and time by the system built-in real
time clock. For the devices that does not have
a real-time clock the parameter should be
read-only and have zero value (0).
variables.name: SCOPUS-COMMON-MIB::scAgentDateAndTime

description: The trap should be sent by the device before it
restarts itself.
The trap should be sent on changes in the next
restart license key.
The license key that will be activated at the next
restart of the device.
variables.name: SCOPUS-COMMON-MIB::scLicenseNextRestartKey

description: The trap should be sent at new alarm registration.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD SCOPUS-COMMON-NOTIFICATIONS-MIB::scAlarmOn SCOPUS-COMMON-MIB::scAlarmCurrentTimestamp s EXAMPLEE SCOPUS-COMMON-MIB::scAlarmEntPhysicalIndex i 9999 SCOPUS-COMMON-MIB::scAlarmIfIndexOrZero i 9999 SCOPUS-COMMON-MIB::scAlarmsConfAlarmType i 1 SCOPUS-COMMON-MIB::scAlarmsConfSeverity i 1 SCOPUS-COMMON-MIB::scAlarmsConfDescription s EXAMPLE

description: The time stamp of the alarm registration. If the
real-time clock of the device is changed
by an external device (NMS or other) the
scAlarmCurrentTimestamp may have irrelevant value.
variables.name: SCOPUS-COMMON-MIB::scAlarmCurrentTimestamp

description: The value of corresponding entPhysicalIndex from
entPhysicalTable.
variables.name: SCOPUS-COMMON-MIB::scAlarmEntPhysicalIndex

description: The value of corresponding ifIndex from ifTable.
Alarms on physical entities should
be reported with scAlarmIfIndexOrZero = 0.
variables.name: SCOPUS-COMMON-MIB::scAlarmIfIndexOrZero

description: Alarm type.
variables.name: SCOPUS-COMMON-MIB::scAlarmsConfAlarmType

description: The severity that the device will report with the
relevant alarm type.
variables.name: SCOPUS-COMMON-MIB::scAlarmsConfSeverity

description: The textual description of the specific alarm type.
variables.name: SCOPUS-COMMON-MIB::scAlarmsConfDescription

description: The trap should be sent on alarm cancellation.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD SCOPUS-COMMON-NOTIFICATIONS-MIB::scAlarmOff SCOPUS-COMMON-MIB::scAlarmCurrentTimestamp s EXAMPLEE SCOPUS-COMMON-MIB::scAlarmEntPhysicalIndex i 9999 SCOPUS-COMMON-MIB::scAlarmIfIndexOrZero i 9999 SCOPUS-COMMON-MIB::scAlarmsConfAlarmType i 1 SCOPUS-COMMON-MIB::scAlarmsConfSeverity i 1 SCOPUS-COMMON-MIB::scAlarmsConfDescription s EXAMPLE

description: The time stamp of the alarm registration. If the
real-time clock of the device is changed
by an external device (NMS or other) the
scAlarmCurrentTimestamp may have irrelevant value.
variables.name: SCOPUS-COMMON-MIB::scAlarmCurrentTimestamp

description: The value of corresponding entPhysicalIndex from
entPhysicalTable.
variables.name: SCOPUS-COMMON-MIB::scAlarmEntPhysicalIndex

description: The value of corresponding ifIndex from ifTable.
Alarms on physical entities should
be reported with scAlarmIfIndexOrZero = 0.
variables.name: SCOPUS-COMMON-MIB::scAlarmIfIndexOrZero

description: Alarm type.
variables.name: SCOPUS-COMMON-MIB::scAlarmsConfAlarmType

description: The severity that the device will report with the
relevant alarm type.
variables.name: SCOPUS-COMMON-MIB::scAlarmsConfSeverity

description: The textual description of the specific alarm type.
variables.name: SCOPUS-COMMON-MIB::scAlarmsConfDescription

description: The trap should be sent when a new interface
is created dynamically (by user ar automatically
by the device).

Summary.eval: ($v1 ne '') ? 'New interface ($v1) is created' : 'New interface is created'

description: The textual name of the interface. The value of this
object should be the name of the interface as assigned by
the local device and should be suitable for use in commands
entered at the device's `console'. This might be a text
name, such as `le0' or a simple port number, such as `1'
depending on the interface naming syntax of the device. If
several entries in the ifTable together represent a single
interface as named by the device, then each will have the
same value of ifName. Note that for an agent which responds
to SNMP queries concerning an interface on some other
(proxied) device, then the value of ifName for such an
interface is the proxied device's local name for it.
If there is no local name, or this object is otherwise not
applicable, then this object contains a zero-length string.
variables.name: IF-MIB::ifName

description: The trap should be sent when an existing interface
is deleted (by user ar automatically
by the device).

Summary.eval: ($v1 ne '') ? 'Existing interface ($v1) is deleted' : 'Existing interface is deleted'

description: The textual name of the interface. The value of this
object should be the name of the interface as assigned by
the local device and should be suitable for use in commands
entered at the device's `console'. This might be a text
name, such as `le0' or a simple port number, such as `1'
depending on the interface naming syntax of the device. If
several entries in the ifTable together represent a single
interface as named by the device, then each will have the
same value of ifName. Note that for an agent which responds
to SNMP queries concerning an interface on some other
(proxied) device, then the value of ifName for such an
interface is the proxied device's local name for it.
If there is no local name, or this object is otherwise not
applicable, then this object contains a zero-length string.
variables.name: IF-MIB::ifName

description: The trap will be sent on the change of one of the
writable system parameters: sysContact, sysLocation or
sysName.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD SCOPUS-COMMON-NOTIFICATIONS-MIB::scSysInfoChanged SNMPv2-MIB::sysContact s EXAMPLE SNMPv2-MIB::sysName s EXAMPLE SNMPv2-MIB::sysLocation s EXAMPLE

description: The textual identification of the contact person for
this managed node, together with information on how
to contact this person. If no contact information is
known, the value is the zero-length string.
variables.name: SNMPv2-MIB::sysContact

description: An administratively-assigned name for this managed
node. By convention, this is the node's fully-qualified
domain name. If the name is unknown, the value is
the zero-length string.
variables.name: SNMPv2-MIB::sysName

description: The physical location of this node (e.g., 'telephone
closet, 3rd floor'). If the location is unknown, the
value is the zero-length string.
variables.name: SNMPv2-MIB::sysLocation

description: The trap will be sent when the user enables/disables
the SNTP update mechanism.

Summary.eval: ($v1==1) ? 'User enabled the SNTP update mechanism' : 'User disabled the SNTP update mechanism'

description: The current status of SNTP service and a command to
change the status.
variables.name: SCOPUS-COMMON-MIB::scSntpEnabled

description: The trap will be sent when the user-defined configuration
of the device is changed.

event.Summary: User-defined configuration of the device is changed

description: A generic trap for event notification.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD SCOPUS-COMMON-NOTIFICATIONS-MIB::scEvent SCOPUS-COMMON-MIB::scEventsCurrentEventId u 1 SCOPUS-COMMON-MIB::scEventsCurrenFreeText s EXAMPLE SCOPUS-COMMON-MIB::scEventsConfSeverity i 1 SCOPUS-COMMON-MIB::scEventsCurrentTimestamp s EXAMPLEE SCOPUS-COMMON-MIB::scEventsCurrentEventType i 9999

description: This is a unique no. identifying the specific instance of this event.
This value can be correlated with other console printouts.
The value is incremented per event issued and 'rolled over' when it reaches the maximum value.
variables.name: SCOPUS-COMMON-MIB::scEventsCurrentEventId

description: This text is formatted by the target.
It contains the Event Description from the scEventsConfTable; with added information about the specific event as well.
variables.name: SCOPUS-COMMON-MIB::scEventsCurrenFreeText

description: The severity of a specific Event type may be changed
by user at any time.
variables.name: SCOPUS-COMMON-MIB::scEventsConfSeverity

description: The time that this event was issued.
variables.name: SCOPUS-COMMON-MIB::scEventsCurrentTimestamp

description: This value is taken from the scEventsConfTable.
variables.name: SCOPUS-COMMON-MIB::scEventsCurrentEventType

description: This trap is sent by the target when a file operation is completed.
File operations are defined in scFileOperationTable (2.1.8.2).
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD SCOPUS-COMMON-NOTIFICATIONS-MIB::scFileOperationCompleted SCOPUS-COMMON-MIB::scFileOperationType i 1 SCOPUS-COMMON-MIB::scFileOperationStatus i 1 SCOPUS-COMMON-MIB::scFileOperationFileName s EXAMPLE

description: Type of the asynchronous operation on files.
variables.name: SCOPUS-COMMON-MIB::scFileOperationType

description: The current status of the operation.
variables.name: SCOPUS-COMMON-MIB::scFileOperationStatus

description: A relevant file name.
variables.name: SCOPUS-COMMON-MIB::scFileOperationFileName

description: This trap is sent by the target when entPhysicalEntry with entPhysicalIndex
is inserted in entPhysicalTable .
A textual description of physical entity. This object
should contain a string that identifies the manufacturer's
name for the physical entity, and should be set to a
distinct value for each version or model of the physical
entity.
variables.name: ENTITY-MIB::entPhysicalDescr

description: This trap is sent by the target when entPhysicalEntry with entPhysicalIndex
is removed from entPhysicalTable.
A textual description of physical entity. This object
should contain a string that identifies the manufacturer's
name for the physical entity, and should be set to a
distinct value for each version or model of the physical
entity.
variables.name: ENTITY-MIB::entPhysicalDescr
